course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Production and Operations Management
course.description: The course introduces concepts, principals and techniques related to the design, planning, management and improvement of both manufacturing and service operations. Topics include demand forecasting and estimation, inventory management, production control and process improvement, queueing systems, procurement and supply chain management.

reviews.author: iimlu
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces basic concepts and principles in production and operations management with focus on quantitative models and analytics. Topics covered in this course include demand forecasting, aggregate planning, inventory control, procurement contracts, and supply chain management etc. The objective of the course is to help students understand fundamental principles and models in production and operations, and prepare themselves in dealing with various problems in production and operations management.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Liu is incredibly kind and patient. She consistently offers clear and concise explanations, ensuring that students grasp the material effectively.
reviews.comment_workload: About 4-5 homeworks, 3-4 questions for each homework.

reviews.author: blue rabt
reviews.title: Good Class
reviews.comment_content: Prof Liu is a very gentle teacher. The content is closely related to operation management.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice content. Inventory management, Ss policy, dynamic programming, which will help us to explore the om field.

Suggestion: some notations are confusing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Neither too high nor too low. I got A. Don't know whether there is any A plus.

Midterm and final term has a proper difficult degree. Neither too difficult nor too easy. Around 70 on average.
reviews.comment_workload:
easy. Several homework with midterm and final term.
Homework is related to several classical papers.
No programming homework.
